title: Linking Words
description: Слушайте и определяйте логические связи между идеями.

tasks.audioText: The company reported record profits last quarter. However, they announced plans to cut five hundred jobs across several departments.
tasks.transcript: However, they announced plans to cut five hundred jobs across several departments.

options.text: Despite the profits, the company still plans significant staff reductions.
The company is hiring more employees because of the record profits.
The company made a loss and needs to cut jobs.
All departments will receive bonuses this quarter.

tasks.explanation: 'However' introduces a contrast. Despite good financial results, the unexpected decision was to reduce the workforce.

tasks.audioText: The experiment yielded very promising results in the laboratory tests. Therefore, the research team decided to proceed with the clinical trials immediately.
tasks.transcript: Therefore, the research team decided to proceed with the clinical trials immediately.

options.text: The team abandoned the project after the laboratory tests.
As a result of the good lab results, they moved forward with human testing.
The clinical trials were cancelled due to poor results.
The team repeated the laboratory tests several more times.

tasks.explanation: 'Therefore' shows a logical consequence. The positive lab results directly led to the decision to begin clinical trials.

tasks.audioText: The new policy has many supporters in the government. Nevertheless, several opposition leaders have raised serious concerns about its implementation.
tasks.transcript: Nevertheless, several opposition leaders have raised serious concerns about its implementation.

options.text: Everyone in government fully supports the new policy.
Despite the support, some opposition figures expressed strong worries about how it would work.
The opposition has no objections to the new policy.
The policy was withdrawn before anyone could comment.

tasks.explanation: 'Nevertheless' signals a concession or contrast. Despite support, opposition concerns exist about implementation.

tasks.audioText: Rebecca wanted to attend the outdoor music festival this weekend. Although it was raining heavily, she decided to go anyway and had a wonderful time.
tasks.transcript: Although it was raining heavily, she decided to go anyway and had a wonderful time.

options.text: She stayed home because of the heavy rain.
Despite the heavy rain, she attended the festival and enjoyed it.
The festival was cancelled due to the weather.
It was sunny and she had a terrible time at the festival.

tasks.explanation: 'Although' introduces a concessive clause. The rain didn't prevent her from going, and she enjoyed the experience.

tasks.audioText: The city centre has excellent public transport connections. Moreover, the area offers a wide range of restaurants, shops, and cultural venues.
tasks.transcript: Moreover, the area offers a wide range of restaurants, shops, and cultural venues.

options.text: In addition to good transport, the area has diverse dining, shopping, and cultural options.
The area only has transport links but nothing else.
The city centre lacks restaurants and shops.
The transport connections are poor but restaurants are good.

tasks.explanation: 'Moreover' adds information to strengthen the previous point. The area has transport AND many other amenities.

tasks.audioText: The athlete trained rigorously for the Olympic qualifying event. Despite months of intensive preparation, she narrowly missed the qualification time.
tasks.transcript: Despite months of intensive preparation, she narrowly missed the qualification time.

options.text: She qualified easily after months of training.
Even with extensive training, she just barely failed to meet the qualifying standard.
She didn't prepare at all for the qualifying event.
She decided not to compete in the Olympic qualifiers.

tasks.explanation: 'Despite' introduces a contrast between effort and result. Her hard training still wasn't quite enough to qualify.

tasks.audioText: The northern region of the country has a cold, harsh climate throughout the year. Whereas the southern coast enjoys mild temperatures and abundant sunshine.
tasks.transcript: Whereas the southern coast enjoys mild temperatures and abundant sunshine.

options.text: Both the north and south have the same climate.
In contrast to the cold north, the south has pleasant weather and lots of sun.
The southern coast also has cold, harsh weather.
The northern region has better weather than the south.

tasks.explanation: 'Whereas' directly contrasts two things. The cold northern climate is opposed to the mild, sunny southern coast.

tasks.audioText: The government increased funding for renewable energy projects significantly. As a result, solar panel installations tripled across the country in just two years.
tasks.transcript: As a result, solar panel installations tripled across the country in just two years.

options.text: The increased funding led to three times more solar installations nationwide in two years.
Solar panel installations decreased despite the extra funding.
The government cut funding for renewable energy.
Solar panels became more expensive after the funding increase.

tasks.explanation: 'As a result' signals a direct consequence. More funding caused a dramatic increase in solar installations.

tasks.audioText: The CEO was known for being strict and demanding with all employees. In spite of his tough reputation, he was incredibly generous with charitable donations.
tasks.transcript: In spite of his tough reputation, he was incredibly generous with charitable donations.

options.text: Contrary to his strict image, he donated very generously to charity.
His strict nature extended to charitable giving as well.
He never donated to any charities.
His employees described him as kind and easygoing.

tasks.explanation: 'In spite of' introduces a surprising contrast. His generous charity work contradicted his tough professional image.

tasks.audioText: The small bakery has been growing steadily over the past five years. Furthermore, they recently won a national award for their sourdough bread.
tasks.transcript: Furthermore, they recently won a national award for their sourdough bread.

options.text: The bakery closed down after five years of poor sales.
On top of their steady growth, they also earned a national bread award.
They stopped making sourdough bread last year.
Their sourdough bread received negative reviews.

tasks.explanation: 'Furthermore' adds supporting information. Not only is the bakery growing, but it also won a prestigious award.

tasks.audioText: Many tourists visit the ancient temple for its historical significance. On the other hand, local residents prefer the nearby modern art gallery.
tasks.transcript: On the other hand, local residents prefer the nearby modern art gallery.

options.text: Both tourists and locals prefer the ancient temple equally.
In contrast to tourists, locals favour the contemporary art gallery instead.
Local residents also love visiting the ancient temple.
The art gallery is closed and nobody visits it.

tasks.explanation: 'On the other hand' presents an opposing viewpoint. Tourists like history; locals prefer modern art.

tasks.audioText: The new employee had no previous experience in the technology sector. Nonetheless, she impressed everyone with her quick learning ability and fresh ideas.
tasks.transcript: Nonetheless, she impressed everyone with her quick learning ability and fresh ideas.

options.text: Her lack of tech experience didn't matter because she learned fast and brought new ideas.
She struggled badly because of her lack of experience.
Nobody noticed that she had no technology background.
She was fired due to her inexperience in the field.

tasks.explanation: 'Nonetheless' introduces an unexpected positive outcome despite a disadvantage. Her qualities overcame her lack of experience.

tasks.audioText: The traffic in the capital has worsened considerably over the last decade. Consequently, the government has invested billions in expanding the metro system.
tasks.transcript: Consequently, the government has invested billions in expanding the metro system.

options.text: The worsening traffic caused the government to spend heavily on metro expansion.
The government reduced spending on public transport.
Traffic improved without any government intervention.
The metro system was shut down to save money.

tasks.explanation: 'Consequently' signals a direct result. Bad traffic was the cause; metro investment was the government's response.

tasks.audioText: Working from home gives employees more flexibility and saves commuting time. Conversely, it can lead to feelings of isolation and difficulty separating work from personal life.
tasks.transcript: Conversely, it can lead to feelings of isolation and difficulty separating work from personal life.

options.text: On the opposite side, remote work may cause loneliness and blurred work-life boundaries.
Working from home has only positive effects on employees.
Remote workers never feel isolated or overworked.
All employees prefer working from home to office work.

tasks.explanation: 'Conversely' presents the opposite perspective. While remote work has benefits, it also has significant drawbacks.

tasks.audioText: The charity struggled to find enough volunteers for the summer programme. Eventually, a local business offered to sponsor the event and recruit staff from their own team.
tasks.transcript: Eventually, a local business offered to sponsor the event and recruit staff from their own team.

options.text: The charity cancelled the programme because no one volunteered.
After some time, a nearby company stepped in to fund and staff the programme.
Many volunteers signed up immediately without any issues.
The local business refused to help the charity.

tasks.explanation: 'Eventually' indicates that after a period of difficulty, a resolution came. The business provided both funding and people.

short_description: Логические связи: however, therefore, moreover и др.
